required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Is the Anterior Superior Iliac Spine a Useful Landmark at Laparoscopy?
clinical_study.official_title: Anterior Superior Iliac Spine - A Useful Surface Anatomical Landmark for Safe and Symmetric Accessory Laparoscopic Port Entry

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study port symmetry and the incidence of anterior abdominal wall neuropathy associated with gynaecological surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: We plan to study patients undergoing gynaecological laparoscopy. Patients will be randomized to two techniques for determining where to position the right and left lateral laparoscopic ports, and port symmetry will be assessed at the end of surgery. We also plan to study patients undergoing any type of gynaecological surgery to determine the incidence of sensory neuropathy involving the lower abdomen according to the route of surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the completion of laparoscopy and before the general anaesthetic is reversed
primary_outcome.description: The precise location in the horizontal and vertical planes of the right and left lateral port sites will be measured to assess port symmetry.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, immediately after and 2 weeks after gynaecological surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Evidence of ilio-hypogastric and ilio-inguinal neuropathy will be sought at the above time frames.

arm_group.description: The position of the right and left laparoscopic port sites will be determined by palpation of the nearby anterior superior iliac spine of the pelvic bone.
The position of the right and left laparoscopic port sites will be determined by visual inspection of the anterior abdominal wall.

intervention.description: The position of the right and left laparoscopic port sites will be determined by palpation of the nearby anterior superior iliac spine of the pelvic bone.
The position of the right and left laparoscopic port sites will be determined by visual inspection of the anterior abdominal wall.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Due to undergo elective gynaecological surgery, including laparoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous laparoscopy
- Junior intern as primary surgeon

responsible_party.name_title: Dr. Adam Magos,. Consultant Gynaecologist/Honorary Senior Lecturer
responsible_party.organization: Royal Free Hospital, Hampstead, London NW3 2QG, UK
